subject: Re: Digital Voice Recorder Advice
author: mllejade
full_text:
Hi Ursula and EVP-ITC community,

I'm new to this group and read with great interest the experiments 
that you've all been involved in.  I agree totally that the 
individual's heart and mind are the most important tools in the 
capturing of EVPs and/or communicating with other dimensions in that 
from my limited personal experience and the observation of others in 
this field, I believe the messenger is just as important as the 
message being conveyed.  In other words, I've observed that in most 
cases, especially in those cases where a group of people are at a 
supposedly haunted locale trying to capture EVP with DVRs, that 
either only one person receives a message to a question or the 
messages received by everyone in the group is different.  This leads 
me to believe that the individual is just as an important a 
channel/receiver as the equipment being employed.  Therefore, I feel 
one must endeavor in one's personal life to strive towards all things 
positive as the laws of attraction apply in that you'll get back what 
you put out (to put in crudely).

Yay, today I'm trekking to Radio Shack through the cold and rain here 
in San Francisco (I know, we Californians are spoiled; we shiver at 
40 degrees and turn to ice at anything under 35 degrees), to get some 
equipment and spend New Year's making my first box (thanks to Mike 
C.'s video, and to Frank S. for pointing me in the right direction)!  

Happy New Year to all,
Sharon

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Ursula Bielski <ursulabielski@...> 
wrote:

> Robin,
>   Glad something helped.  
>   Beyond my thoughts, I totally agree that the choice of equipment 
is part of the ritual, and that having respect and passion for the 
process of choosing can actually add to the positive vibrations. 
Although, as previously stated, I believe with Mark Macy that the 
mind and heart are the most important tools in all this, how touched 
those on the other side must be to witness our fervent and abundant 
exchanges as we try to hash out the details of our equipment trials!  
Surely this heightens the love on their end--and their efforts to 
give us the contacts we desire. Something to think about.
>   Best to all,
>   Ursula
